senses.de: A person who is learning a job by working for an expert in the field
senses.ex: Tom is an apprentice in a hair salon where he learns styling techniques from master stylists.

Tips.title: Working While Learning
Tips.description: An apprentice gains hands-on experience while being taught by a professional.
Tips.example: Maria became an apprentice at the bakery to learn decorating cakes professionally.

Tips.title: Paid to Learn
Tips.description: Unlike interns, apprentices are usually paid as they are training on the job.
Tips.example: As an apprentice electrician, Leo earns a wage while he masters his skills.

Tips.title: Formal Training
Tips.description: Apprenticeship often includes structured training and might lead to a qualification.
Tips.example: After completing her apprenticeship, Jenna received a certificate in carpentry.

senses.ex: She was apprenticed to a local baker to learn the trade.

Tips.title: Becoming Skilled
Tips.description: To apprentice in a job is to begin learning the skills necessary for that profession.
Tips.example: He apprenticed with a tailor for two years before opening his own shop.

Tips.title: Starting Young
Tips.description: Apprenticing typically involves younger individuals starting a career path, but not exclusively.
Tips.example: She apprenticed at the flower shop right after high school.

Tips.title: Mentorship Relationship
Tips.description: Apprenticeship involves learning under the supervision of a more experienced mentor.
Tips.example: Apprenticed to the city's finest chef, he quickly learned the secrets of the kitchen.

Acolyte.wordDefinition:
An acolyte is usually a religious term used to describe someone who assists a priest or minister during religious ceremonies, such as lighting candles or carrying the cross.

An acolyte is applicable in religious contexts, while an apprentice is applicable in trades or professions that require a certain level of skill or expertise.

Beginner.wordDefinition:
Beginner refers to someone who is new to a particular activity or skill and has little to no experience in it.

For example, someone who has never played basketball before might be considered a beginner if they join a basketball team for the first time.

Apprentice suggests formal training and a desire to become an expert in a particular field, while beginner simply refers to someone who is new to a particular activity or skill.

Intern.wordDefinition:
An intern is someone who usually completes a temporary work placement or internship to gain practical experience and exposure to a particular industry or field.

Interns may perform a range of tasks and duties, such as administrative work, data entry, research, or assisting with projects or events.

The main difference between apprenticeships and internships is that apprenticeships are focused on developing a specific skill or trade, while internships are more broad-based opportunities to explore a particular industry or field.

Learn.wordDefinition:
Apprentice refers to the person who is learning a skill or trade under the guidance of a skilled worker, while learn is the act of acquiring knowledge or skill through study, experience, or teaching.

If you want to learn how to play the piano, you might take lessons or study online tutorials in order to acquire the necessary skills and knowledge.

Apprentice is used when referring to more hands-on, practical training while learn can apply to a wider range of learning experiences, including academic or self-directed study.

Novice.wordDefinition:
Novice generally refers to someone who is new to a particular activity, skill or field of knowledge, and lacks experience or expertise in that area.

An apprentice is someone who is specifically learning and training for a skilled trade or profession, while a novice is someone who is new to something and has yet to gain significant experience or mastery.

Protege.wordDefinition:
An apprentice is a person who is learning a skill or trade from a more experienced person, while a protege is a person who is guided and supported in their professional or personal development by someone more experienced or influential.

A protege is usually someone who has already established themselves in their career or chosen field. They are being mentored by someone who is more experienced or successful than they are, with the goal of advancing to a higher level of success or influence themselves.

A protege may receive coaching, advice, and networking opportunities from their mentor.

An apprentice is someone who is learning from an experienced mentor to develop their skills and gain experience, while a protege is being guided and supported by a mentor to achieve greater success in their established career or field.

Rookie.wordDefinition:
A rookie is someone who is new to a particular profession or activity. They lack experience, but they are typically enthusiastic and eager to learn.

Rookies are common in sports, where young athletes are just starting their professional careers, but the term can be used in a variety of contexts.

So, in short, an apprentice is someone who is learning a specific skill or trade from an experienced professional, while a rookie is someone who is new to a particular profession or activity.

Trainee.wordDefinition:
In contrast, a trainee refers to a person who is learning through instruction, observation, and practice under the supervision of a trainer.

Meanwhile, traineeships are more likely to be seen in professional settings such as business, healthcare, and information technology, where practical skills and theoretical knowledge both are significant.

The primary difference between these two terms is that an apprentice is trained through work, while a trainee receives instruction and practical experience.

Tyro.wordDefinition:
Tyro refers to a person who is new to a particular skill or activity, and is still in the early stages of learning. For example, a person who is new to playing basketball and is still learning the basics.

An apprentice is someone who is learning a skill or trade from a mentor, while a tyro is someone who is new to a skill or activity and is still in the early stages of learning.

quotes.Text: If you apprentice yourself to the smartest people who will take you seriously, you will learn at every step. You'll learn their special language. You'll see what real people do. Your interests might surprise you. They will evolve. And you'll be well-positioned to take advantage of whatever opportunity life throws your way.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Marc Randolph

quotes.Text: Everything you need you already have. You are complete right now, you are a whole, total person, not an apprentice person on the way to someplace else. Your completeness must be understood by you and experienced in your thoughts as your own personal reality.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Wayne Dyer

quotes.Text: With 'Interpreter,' I didn't know it was ever going to be a book, that they were going to be published. I was writing them in a vacuum for the most part. They were my apprentice work. Then the stories happened to become a book.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Jhumpa Lahiri

quotes.Text: We need women to go through apprentice programs. I've seen women who did, and who are now highly trained electricians and welders. These are jobs that women are capable of doing.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Hilda Solis

quotes.Text: If an apprentice does not hear what a master hears, is then that quality not present in the music? Yes and no. In the world in which the apprentice lives no.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Robert Fripp

quotes.Text: It is the artist who realizes that there is a supreme force above him and works gladly away as a small apprentice under God's heaven.
quotes.Title: Russian Author
quotes.Name: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quotes.Text: The profession of a prostitute is the only career in which the maximum income is paid to the newest apprentice.
quotes.Title: British Leader
quotes.Name: William Booth

quotes.Text: We are all apprentices in a craft where no one ever becomes a master.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.Text: Always two there are, a master and an apprentice.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Frank Oz
